subject: Ethics
title: Criminal Record Expungement Online
description: A micro-lesson that makes Criminal Record Expungement Online usable.

hook.text: You served time, paid your debt, and got your record cleared. But Google still shows your mugshot on page one.

buildup.text: Mugshot websites scrape arrest records and post photos. Some charge hundreds to remove them. It's a shakedown.

discovery.text: Legal expungement clears court records, but can't force private websites to delete. The internet has no eraser.

twist.text: This traps formerly incarcerated people in digital punishment long after their legal punishment ends.

climax.text: If society says you've paid your debt, but the internet keeps collecting, who's really in charge of justice?

punchline.text: Your record is clear, but your search results aren't.

quiz.question: Why doesn't criminal record expungement fully work online?
options: Courts don't have jurisdiction over private websites
Expungement is illegal in most US states
All criminal records are permanently public domain
